intro: Chonemorpha assamensis, commonly known as the Assam sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic wood and fragrant leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at moderate altitudes. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. The flowers are small and white, often clustered in inflorescences, and the fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds.
